text: my name is Mari Oliver and I'm suing my
school I'm suing my school because
they've taken action against me
exercising my constitutional rights
the pledge of allegiance is something we
say every day at school and is
essentially us pledging allegiance to
the United States I sit because I don't
believe that we live in a country where
there's justice and freedom for all the
worst experience I've had was when a
student called me out in class got in my
face and started cursing at me I felt
put on the spot and attacked I think
what made it even harder was when my
principals at my school didn't take
action against that student
it's hard being a black woman in the
United States because there is still
racism and Prejudice if you look to the
workforce it's harder for us to find
jobs and I think that that prejudice
starts at a young age and I face that in
high school I love that he's taking a
stand on the national level and I'm
hoping that he's also shedding light on
people kind of like me who don't really
have a bigger voice and want to start a
movement and want to shed light on these
big political issues
everyone is entitled to their opinions
and their beliefs I think that we do
live in a country where everyone can
have their own values and we still need
to learn how to coexist with each other
and not say negative and mean comments
towards something that we just don't
agree with I think that we the people
can change the world and it's up to us
to make a difference
you
